column4: Hi, I've a strange problem: I've made a symlink to a directory in the /usr/bin to /usr/X11R6, strangly when I type for example X (which is in /usr/X11R6) nothing happens, does anyone know what might be te sollution?
nothing  happens ? or you get a command not found ?
ls -l yourlink
ow yes, stupid, sory, didn't see it, it points to: ../X11R6/bin
if I cd to X11 I also see the binaries
uff, some minutes ago you noticed the link was pointing to the wrong place, is it already fixed :) ?
lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 12 2008-04-20 19:53 X11 -> ../X11R6/bin
I felt stupid because I miread ls for ln ;)
that's your /usr/bin ?
that's #root@/usr/bin: ls -l X11
echo $PATH
/sbin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin
/usr/bin/X11 is not on your path
you dont have the libraries on the library search path, for those binaries
what are you trying to achieve ?
where do I modify the the library search path normaly?
first I want the X server running, then I'd like to install Xfce
/etc/ld.so.conf
why didn't you used the repositories applications ?
TNX very much, this took me so long!
I'm building an LFS system ;)
ouch, so you are offtopic , try ##linux instead
by mistake installed Xorg 6.9, quiet old, but there's no make uninstall, and I'm not using a package manager
